title: Peter Himmelman Band
itunes:title: Peter Himmelman Band
description:
Peter Himmelman’s decades-long career can hardly be distilled into anything as simple as a “singer-songwriter” tag. Nevertheless, during the SNAP era, he was best known for his deeply humanistic, literate, and thoughtful songwriting, played here without fuss by the Peter Himmelman Band.

The sextet focuses on material from Himmelman’s then-new album, 1991’s aptly-named “From Strength to Strength.”

 The sextet focuses on material from Himmelman’s then-new album, 1991’s aptly-named “From Strength to Strength.”
media:description: Songwriter Peter Himmelman’s career was firmly on the upswing during his run of SNAP appearances. In his third and final show, he performs his humanistic and perfectly crafted Americana with a full band, focusing on material...
author: webmaster@kcrw.org (KCRW, Tricia Halloran)
itunes:author: KCRW, Tricia Halloran
content:encoded:
Peter Himmelman’s decades-long career can hardly be distilled into anything as simple as a “singer-songwriter” tag. Nevertheless, during the SNAP era, he was best known for his deeply humanistic, literate, and thoughtful songwriting, played here without fuss by the Peter Himmelman Band.

The sextet focuses on material from Himmelman’s then-new album, 1991’s aptly-named “From Strength to Strength.”
